Summary

Roundly is a library for creating composable HTML components in pure Go. Instead of writing template files, which needs to be wired to go in some way, roundly allows you to write your components as go functions.

So there is no need for any runtime parsing of templates or code generation while development. Instead you get the type safety you know from go

Here is how roundly components looks like: 

						Table(
						    Attributes(
						        Id("mascot-table"),
						        Class("fancy-table", "mascots"),
						    ),
						    Thead(nil,
						        Tr(nil,
						            ThText("Language"),
						            ThText("Kind"),
						            ThText("Name"),
						        ),
						    ),
						    Tbody(nil,
						        Range([]Mascot{
						            {"Go", "Blue Gopher", "The Go Gopher"},
						            {"Rust", "Orange Crab", "Ferris"},
						            {"Gleam", "Pink Starfish", "Lucy"},
						            {"Zig", "Ziguana", "Ziggy & Zero"},
						            {"Java", "?", "Duke"},
						        }, func(i int, mascot Mascot) roundly.Element {
						            return Tr(nil,
						                Th(ScopeRow(), Text(mascot.Language)),
						                TdText(mascot.Kind),
						                TdText(mascot.Name),
						            )
						        }),
						    ),
						)
